body_html:
@F3PiX may I jump in with some thoughts?
I like the idea of still showing all projects that have been submitted, regardless of whether they are participating with a team or not. I'm not sure if in this case making some projects visible only during the selection period makes sense and if it's something we want.
I could imagine using the status tag for this and letting the user / visitor filter/order the list. This would mean for example adding an extra tag (right now we just use rejected and accepted, we could have another one for participating). I'm not sure how the tag system is currently implemented and whether it would be easy to add another tag (and also, whether this is something we want). But ultimately it feels right to me — this is the status of the project, after all.
I'm wondering what you think about this? :)

@F3PiX may I jump in with some thoughts?
I like the idea of still showing all projects that have been submitted, regardless of whether they are participating with a team or not. I'm not sure if in this case making some projects visible only during the selection period makes sense and if it's something we want.
I could imagine using the `status` tag for this and letting the user / visitor filter/order the list. This would mean for example adding an extra tag (right now we just use `rejected` and `accepted`, we could have another one for `participating`). I'm not sure how the tag system is currently implemented and whether it would be easy to add another tag (and also, whether this is something we want). But ultimately it _feels_ right to me — this is the status of the project, after all. 
I'm wondering what you think about this? :)
